file_content.text: Battle droid ambush. Pretty heavy casualties, I hear.
And we're all stuck here in port!
Master Jedi--you gotta do something. We need to get out there and help our guys, but our transports are all grounded.
My transport's scheduled to leave today. The guys in my unit are finally gonna get some help.
Nice work! They already started the medship transports, and reinforcement deployments are being prioritized.
This who I'm looking for, private?
Yes, sir.
Captain Haren, second infantry. Thank you for getting our transports off the ground. You've done us a great service today.
It's all because Private Vekker wanted to get back to his unit so badly. You could use a man like him on the front.
You should thank Vekker.
I certainly could. Which is why I've just signed his deployment orders. You're headed back to your unit, Vekker.
It's what I do.
You probably noticed Vekker here is a man of duty too. Which is why I'm re-deploying him today. You're back in action, Vekker.
Next time try taking charge before the Empire cripples your whole outfit.
Don't let this happen again.
Right... Well, now that the transports are running, I'm sending out reinforcements. Vekker, grab your gear. You're headed back to your unit.
Yes, sir! Thank you, sir!
The sooner you take out that jamming equipment, the sooner we can get our reinforcements and wounded back in the air.
What about my unit?
Major, you're Havoc Squad--you can do something, right? We can't back up our units 'cause the blasted transports are all grounded.
You can do something about this, can't you? We gotta get out there and help our guys, but our transports are all grounded.
Why are the transports grounded?
What happened?
Your dedication shows character.
I like your commitment.
I like your attitude, private. Does a fellow trooper proud.
That's the spirit.
Thanks, but I'm no model soldier. Give me five minutes alone with the scum that grounded our flights, and I'll show ya.
Count your blessings, kid. Combat's no picnic.
What's the hurry?
Combat's where I can do some good. If we ever get back there.
Pull yourself together!
That's not easy when your friends are stuck fighting a war without reinforcements.
Get this--our own ships started showing up as enemy blips on our scanners. Turns out it's an Imperial signal jamming operation.
Command grounded all flights after our fleet shot down three of our own medship transports.
Have your people tracked down the jamming signal?
Tell me about their operation.
They've set up in an old traffic control tower. But they're not dumb.
How many people aboard the medical transports?
That's horrible!
Couple hundred--Imps probably planned it that way. We all want to hit back.
Soldiers follow orders. They don't elicit help outside their chain of command.
Stick to your job, private.
Look, I promise I'll tell my CO about this if you help, okay? But command is up against a wall here.
The Empire's got a massive force protecting their operation--too big for our local units to handle.
If you don't cut through their defenses and shut down those jammers, I don't know who will.
Don't worry, your transports will be airborne soon enough.
I'll do it.
This Imperial trickery is unacceptable, and I intend to stop it.
I'll do it.
In Havoc Squad, being outnumbered is just another day at the office.
I'll do it.
Outnumbered isn't outmanned, right, Major?
Getting those transports in the air is just good business.
I'll do it.
Whatever gets our guys the help they need.
It's beneath me... but fine.
You won't regret it, I promise.
The jamming equipment's probably in the control tower, so you'll have to get access.
I'll tell my superiors that you're going in.
Sorry, I don't have time to fix your logistical problems.
Forget it.
You're kidding, right? Then how are we supposed to reinforce our battlefield units?
Just waiting for my deployment orders.
